sentences: Roberto Martin Fernandez Nievera (; born November 30, 1986) is a Filipino singer-songwriter and record producer.
section: N/A

sentences: He is a former VJ for the music channel Myx and radio DJ at Wish 107.5.
section: N/A

sentences: The eldest child of singers Martin Nievera and Pops Fernandez, he began his own professional career as a VJ after winning Myx VJ Search 2010.
section: N/A

sentences: At the time of this success, he was studying music production at De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde and serving as the vocalist and guitarist of an indie rock band.
section: N/A

sentences: Nievera tried deviating from his musical parents as a child, but eventually became interested in music after learning to play the guitar in school.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2012, Nievera signed with PolyEast Records and released his debut album, the blues rock-influenced Overwait, for which he won New Male Recording Artist of the Year at the PMPC Star Awards for Music.
section: N/A

sentences: He was the producer for No More Words (2012), a duet album by his parents.
section: N/A

sentences: Nievera has since self-produced his subsequent albums.
section: N/A

sentences: He mounted his first solo concert in 2013, in support of his second album, Nightmares (2012), which he had independently made available a few months prior.
section: N/A

sentences: He signed with Homeworkz and released Dare, his third album which explored alternative pop, in stages throughout 2016, during which he ventured into radio, hosting The Roadshow at Wish 107.5 until 2018.
section: N/A

sentences: Nievera is currently based in Los Angeles, California.
section: N/A

sentences: Roberto Martin Fernandez Nievera was born on November 30, 1986 to singers Martin Nievera and Pops Fernandez.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He was named for his paternal grandfather (Roberto "Bert" Nievera) and his father.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He has a younger brother named Martin Ramon (nicknamed "Ram").
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Nievera made brief appearances in his parents' concerts as a child.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He began singing and playing in church when he was around fourteen years old, although he had been trying to deviate from music.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: When he was under ten, Nievera had no intentions of becoming "a singer or anything in music".
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: When he was twelve, he learned to play the guitar as a school requirement: "I picked [the guitar] out of laziness.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In my school, you had to take either voice lessons, which meant reading notes – I didn't know how to do that – or learn piano, which looks very complicated because there are so many little keys."
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He also learned to play by observing other musicians.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He became friends with the guitarists and other musicians in his church, who helped him master the instrument.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Nievera joined a band at eighteen, during which he started to realize that "I want to do this.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: I really thought music was the one thing that I wanted to be better at.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: "Nievera began writing the songs for his debut album in 2008.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He contributed one of these songs, "Smile", to Regine Velasquez's 2010 album, Fantasy.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: While studying music production at De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde and serving as the vocalist and guitarist of an indie rock band called Wagyu, Nievera won Myx VJ Search 2010 by the music channel Myx.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He said he joined the competition because "I love talking.

sentences: I love to talk besides making music [because] I like making people laugh.

sentences: I like doing things with the camera."
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Nievera said of the start of his career, "Before I was just busy.

sentences: Nievera signed with PolyEast Records and launched Overwait on March 14, 2012.

sentences: Discussing the album, he said: "The concept ... was to make original music and to sound different but not to sound like too foreign."

section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: Nievera composed the entire album.

section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: The album's lead single is "In 3's", which was followed by "Smile".

section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: Nievera performed songs from Overwait as he opened for the American pop rock band Hanson on its Shout It Out World Tour in Manila on March 30, 2012.

sentences: In September 2012, Nievera won New Male Recording Artist of the Year for Overwait at the 4th PMPC Star Awards for Music.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: Nievera self-released Nightmares, his second album which he solely composed and produced, for free download from his website in December 2012.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: In March 2013, Nievera embarked on his first solo show called The Nightmares Concert, based on the Nightmares album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: It was held at Teatrino Greenhills in San Juan, Metro Manila, and also featured songs from Overwait and performances by The John Sung Band and The Walkie Talkies whose members were Nievera's classmates in college.

sentences: Zia Quizon was a special guest.

sentences: So she planned out going to Teatrino, paying the downpayment.

section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: He was announced to host Daily Top Ten, a music show of Viva TV featuring up-and-coming Filipino musicians.

sentences: At Myx Music Awards 2013, he was nominated for Favorite New Artist.

section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: In January 2014, Nievera said that he was planning "to do a lot of things, music-oriented, Internet-oriented, and out of music-oriented."
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: He announced that his contract with PolyEast would expire at the end of the month, and he was "starting a new band but it's going to be an independent release."

sentences: He explained that he "won't get a record label" because "I wanna do it on my own ...

sentences: I wanna know how it works."

sentences: Nievera had been conceptualizing a third album with his new band, which he was intending to release online for free download by June 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: He was also reported to perform weekly at a newly opened music bar on Pioneer Street in Mandaluyong.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: Outside his music career, aside from hosting Daily Top Ten, Nievera had been selling real estate to be more productive.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: In February 2015, Nievera mentioned that he was developing his own web series featuring emerging musicians which was to be released on YouTube.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===

sentences: He mounted a concert, The Next Attraction, at the Music Museum in San Juan, Metro Manila in July 2015, with Isabella Gonzalez, Paolo Valenciano, and Karylle (children of his parents' contemporaries, Kuh Ledesma, Gary Valenciano, and Zsa Zsa Padilla, respectively).
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2015: Overwait, Nightmares, and The Next Attraction ===
